sect2.title: Utilities
sect2.para: There have been many improvements to the GNOME utilities. Here is a selection.

sect3.title: Character Map
sect3.para:
GNOME's Unicode character picker has been improved, so it is now even easier to paste unusual characters into your documents. For instance,
Searching for a character is now easier.
It is easier to see one set of characters at a time.
Character Map
The Character Map, showing characters from the TODO script.

sect3.title: PDF Viewer
sect3.para:
The PDF viewer now has several features that users missed in the previous version, such as:
There are now sidebars for bookmarks and page thumbnails.
You can now open password-protected files.
There is now a full-screen mode.
TrueType fonts are now supported.
Clicking on a URL will now open it in a web browser.
PDF Viewer
The PDF Viewer, with page thumbnails.

sect3.title: Sound Recorder
sect3.para:
The Sounds recorder now offers a selection of audio profiles, such as "Voice Quality", which the user can edit. Other applications, such as Sound Juicer can use these same audio profiles.
PDF Viewer
The Sounds Recorder, showing audio profiles.

sect3.title: Volume Control
sect3.para:
The Volume Control now supports ALSA as well as OSS sound drivers, as used by many Linux distributions and the Linux 2.6 kernel. The simple volume control panel applet also supports this.
